resources.string: "300g beetroot, peeled/n 50g butter/n 1 small onion, 1 small carrot, 1 stick of celery, 1 small leek:/n all peeled where necessary and cut into small dice or rings/n 2 grains allspice/n ½ bay leaf/n 1.5l gelatinous beef stock/n 2 medium floury potatoes, eg Maris Piper, peeled and cut into small dice/n ½ small cabbage, shredded /n 4 cloves garlic, peeled and crushed /n 2 tbsp cider vinegar /n 1 tsp sugar /n ½ tsp ground black pepper /n Sour cream and fresh dill, to serve (preferably Polish sour cream, which has a richer flavour)/n "

" Cut ¾ of the peeled beetroot into small dice /n(you may want to wear rubber gloves to do this) and set the rest aside./n Melt the butter in a large pan, /n and then soften the onion over a gentle heat for 5 minutes./n 2. Add the carrot, leek, celery, diced beetroot, allspice and bay leaf and stir well to coat with butter. /n Cook for another 10 minutes, adding a little stock if the vegetables begin to look dry./n Meanwhile, grate the remaining beetroot./n
3. Pour in the rest of the stock and the potatoes and simmer for 15 minutes, then add the cabbage, garlic and grated beetroot./n Cook until all the vegetables are tender (about 10 minutes)./n
4. Add the vinegar, sugar, pepper and a pinch of salt and taste. /n Add a little more of any of these if necessary, /n then serve with a dollop of sour cream, a sprig of dill, and some Polish bread on the side. /n "

"1/2 medium cabbage;/n 4 cups of sauerkraut;/n 1 can tomato paste;/n 1/2 lb bacon sliced;/n 1 lb pork diced (any parts that can be sautéed is good);/n 1 lb Kielbasa sausage sliced /n (optionally substitute with a quality sausage from your butcher);/n 1 large onion diced;/n 2 cloves garlic minced;/n 1 bay leaf;/n Optional salt and pepper to taste;/n"

" Cut your washed cabbage in thin slices and boil until tender in a pot. Boil the sauerkraut in another pot in about 2 cups of water. Strain and keep the sour water aside. Sauté your diced pork in a pan with some cooking oil (lard, coconut oil or butter are good), then set aside. Sauté the bacon and sausage with the onion and garlic. In a large pot, combine the cooked cabbage, sauerkraut, sour water, tomato paste, spices and your cooked meats, onion and garlic. Let simmer for about 1 hour. Enjoy with your family and friends!"

"1 large bunch of dill/n 0.5kg of soup vegetables /n (such as: parsley, celery, leek, carrots)/n 1 medium onion /n 200 ml sour cream or yoghurt /n 30 ounces of veal ribs or other meat with bone /n 1 tablespoon of flour /n 1 bay leaf /n salt, pepper /n"

" Prepare a veal stock with 2 litres of water. /n To the pot add 1 small onion during cooking the broth. /n Add greens and then rest of vegetables. /n If you want to have full-vegetable version of this soup, throw chopped vegetables after 20 minutes of meat cooking. /n If you want, however, to get rid of it and serve a clean soup, as it is usually prefered, /n throw all vegetables at the beginning. /n Add salt to taste. Now, cook the soup about 1 hour - until meat and vegetables will be soft. /n When broth is ready it is time for our dill. /n Cut very finely half of the bundle (the one closer to roots). /n Than fry it for 1-2 minutes on a hot pan and throw into the soup. /n Now, take the pot out from fire and remove meat. /n Mix cream with flour if you like a bit thicker soup. /n Pour few tablespoons of soup to the cream /n (so the cream does not coagulate after adding it to the hot soup). /n Then mix it all and pour to the pot with a dill soup. /n Slowly heat all together for the last time. Leave it for a moment to let all flavors merge. /n Now chop all remaining dill and throw directly into the pot. Mix the whole. /n Prepare batter dumplings of hard boiled eggs to be served with you dill soup. /n "
